meanings.definition: Kenafs (noun): plural form of kenaf, a plant of the mallow family grown for its fiber
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested the kenafs from his field.
meanings.sent2: Kenafs are used to make eco-friendly textiles.
meanings.sent3: The kenafs in the garden seemed to be whispering to each other.
meanings.sent4: The kenafs swayed gently in the breeze, like a group of dancers.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of the kenafs stood out against the brown soil.

meanings.definition: Kenafs (verb): third person singular present of kenaf, to grow kenaf plants
meanings.sent1: She kenafs in her backyard every summer.
meanings.sent2: He carefully kenafs to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors were surprised to see her kenafing in the city.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to kenafing was as strong as the roots of the plants.
meanings.sent5: The fields kenafed with life as the plants grew tall and strong.

meanings.definition: Kenafs (adjective): describing something related to or made from kenaf fibers
meanings.sent1: The kenafs bag was both stylish and sustainable.
meanings.sent2: She wore a kenafs dress to the eco-friendly event.
meanings.sent3: The kenafs curtains added a natural touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: His kenafs hat shielded him from the sun with its sturdy fibers.
meanings.sent5: The kenafs rope was strong enough to hold the weight of the boat.
